results.title: New York University: physical rehabilitation
results.creator_credit: CBS Television, Irving Gitlin and Al Wasserman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Search”.
Shows how a paraplegic war veteran learns again to stand, walk, climb stairs, sit in a wheel chair and finally achieve a symbolic goal; getting a cup of water from a cooler by himself. Shows this veteran as the focal point of many new skills and techniques.

results.title: New York stories
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Jack Rollins, Charles H. Joffe, Fred Roos, Fred Fuchs, Robert Greenhut, Martin Scorsese, Francis Ford Coppola and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: A wildly diverse, star-studded trilogy about life in New York. “Life lessons”, directed by Martin Scorsese and starring Nick Nolte and Rosanna Arquette is a passionate tale of a world-famous painter torn between his passion for his art and his infatuation with his unresponsive assistant. “Life without Zoe”, directed by Coppola, stars Talia Shire and Giancarlo Giannini in a whimsical fantasy about childlike parents and a very grown-up daughter. Original music by Carmine Coppola. “Oedipus wrecks” has Woody Allen directing and starring in a comedy about a neurotic lawyer who cannot escape the woman who literally looms largest in his life - his mother. Also stars Mia Farrow, Mae Questal and Julie Kavner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Touchstone Pictures, Jack Rollins, Charles H. Joffe, Fred Roos, Fred Fuchs, Robert Greenhut, Martin Scorsese, Francis Ford Coppola and Woody Allen

results.title: New York lightboard
results.brief_description: Paper cutouts were used for Norman McLaren’s single-frame animation of linear symbols in this Canadian tourism publicity clip. Projected in Times Square, New York, the large signboard was made up of thousands of light bulbs activated by the film images.

results.title: New York
results.creator_credit: Pilot Films, Benita Matofska and Paul McGuiaan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
New York is a vast metropolis and its famous skyline makes it one of the world’s most spectacular cities. New York is also home to a multitude of ethnic groups who have created a mosaic of diverse cultures and enclaves. Ian Wright visits the famous landmarks found in every promotional brochure but also finds some interesting surprises rarely visited by tourists off the beaten track. Activities covered include: budget hotels, yellow taxis and New York clubland, kosher food on the Lower East Side, visits to the Empire State Building, Central Park and the Statue of Liberty, Harlem, the Bronx and Brooklyn, and a helicopter flight over the city.

results.title: New year sacrifice = Zhu fu [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Beijing Film Studio and Sang Hu
results.brief_description: A tragic story that highlights the humiliations and hardships endured by women in traditional Chinese society, focusing on the life of a twice widowed, middle-aged village woman. Her last hopes of happiness are shattered by the news of the death her son. Cast includes Yang Bai and Wei Heling. In Mandarin with English subtitles. Based on the original work by the famous writer Lu Xun.

results.title: New worlds for old
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Maslyn Williams
results.brief_description: A survey of the progress being made in Papua and New Guinea, showing new industries, new roads and means of transport, the introduction of sheep, cattle and goats, and the way in which the natives are being encouraged to cooperate in these activities.

results.title: New weapons against crime
results.creator_credit: CBS News, Burton Benjamin and Norton Bloom
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Demonstrates the application of modern technology to combat crime. Shows uses of computers, voice prints, olefactronics to identify odours, video tape to record crimes, electronic eavesdropping devices, and chemicals to restrain violence.

results.title: New ways with wool
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Les Davidson and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: The production of many new types of synthetic fibres is a threat to the future of the Australian wool industry - the chemist is producing new materials more closely resembling the characteristics of wool. This film, showing how the wool industry is meeting this challenge, is an account of the work being done at various research centres throughout the Commonwealth, investigating and improving the production, processing, and use of wool.
